title: What's the difference in music between streams vs record sales? - Quora

response.answer_text: What's the difference in music between streams vs record sales? The Streaming company pays a tiny fixed sum per stream to the artist. An album streamed a million times might earn enough to cover production costs. No income for artists. A million-selling physical album would pay the rent for a decade. This is why making an album is no longer a good risk. Unless you’re going to get tens of millions of streams, you’re going to struggle to recover costs. The digital content genie is out of the bottle, and it’s killing off being a creative musician as a career. The streaming companies take massive income - but still, make losses. The artists just get annoyed, and hungry.

RIAA standard is 1500 streams equals 1 physical album sale. So 10,000 physical sales is the equivalent of 15,00,000 streams. The average metal band will do about 30k in their first week, so the equivalent is 45M streams
